sentences.en: After his nephew left, two gentlemen came into Scrooge's office.
sentences.cn: 他侄儿走后, 有两位男士进入史克鲁奇的办公室.

sentences.en: Bob was copying letters in a small dark room next to Scrooge's.
sentences.cn: 鲍伯正在史克鲁奇隔壁一间狭小阴暗的房间中抄写一些信件.

sentences.en: Oh, spirit , tell me , please. Will Tiny Tim live? cried Scrooge.
sentences.cn: 史克鲁奇叫道:“哦, 鬼魂, 请告诉我小提姆会活下去 吗 ?”

sentences.en: One Christmas Eve, old Scrooge was counting his money in his office.
sentences.cn: 有一年圣诞节前夕, 老史克鲁奇正在他的办公室里算钱.

sentences.en: Poor Cratchit hurried home to family before Scrooge could change his mind.
sentences.cn: 可怜的克罗奇急忙往家跑,生怕史高治改变主意.

sentences.en: Scrooge didn't yet know whose death they were talking about.
sentences.cn: 史克鲁奇还不知道他们谈论的是谁死了.

sentences.en: Scrooge is scared by what he sees and promises to change.
sentences.cn: 斯克鲁奇对他所看到的一切感到惊恐,他承诺要有所改变.

sentences.en: Scrooge later became Tiny Tim's benefactor.
sentences.cn: 斯克路基后来成了蒂尼·蒂姆的保护人.

sentences.en: Scrooge sees Tiny Tim, Bob's youngest son, on crutches.
sentences.cn: 斯克鲁奇看到鲍勃的小儿子小提姆(Tinytim)倚着拐杖.

sentences.en: Scrooge went to them to listen to their talk.
sentences.cn: 史克鲁奇便走向前去听他们谈话.

sentences.en: Scrooge wept to see his own poor forgotten self.
sentences.cn: 史克鲁奇看到当年遭人遗忘而又可怜的自己,便哭了起来.

sentences.en: Sim did a phenomenal job presenting the heartless, miserly, self - centered Scrooge.
sentences.cn: 他成功地演绎了这个无情 、 吝啬 、 自我 中心的主人翁.

sentences.en: The old man is a scrooge.
What a scrooge! He didn't even buy presents for them on Christmas!
sentences.cn: 真是小气巴拉! 他甚至没送他们圣诞礼物.

sentences.en: With books and papers in their hands, they bowed to Scrooge.
sentences.cn: 他们手持书本和文件, 向史克鲁奇鞠躬致意.
